availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David Gillum (Trimble County, Ky, farmer and carpenter)

body.p: Trimble County, Kentucky, farmer and carpenter. Kentucky native. Son of Polly Gillum. Married to Mary J. Gillum. Father of Sarah Gillum, Mary Gillum, Charles Gillum, William Gillum, Amelia E. Gillum, and Lucy J. Gillum. Farmer in Trimble County, Kentucky in 1850. Carpenter in Trimble County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County,District 1, p. 421A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, p. 223.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, Bedford, p. 177B.
Find A Grave, "David Gillum (1823-1896)," Memorial #22590628, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22590628 (accessed August 26, 2020).
